title: Windsor woman killed in crash
content:
Posted Monday, September 14th 2015 @ 10am  by 1310 WIBA/Dane County Sheriff's Dept 
 
Sunday, September 13, 2015– At 5:27 p.m., Dane County Sheriff’s deputies, along with Deforest Fire Department and EMS, Waunakee EMS, and Arlington EMS responded to a two vehicle crash with injuries on Portage Rd. near Finch Trail in the Township of Windsor. 
 
The preliminary investigation indicates a 71 year-old male from Windsor and his 77 year old wife were traveling southbound on Portage Rd. and were making a right turn into their driveway when they were struck on the passenger side by a vehicle also traveling southbound on Portage Rd. The second vehicle was occupied by three teenagers from the area. 
 
The 77 year old passenger of the struck vehicle later died at UW Hospital as result of injuries sustained in the crash. The occupants of both vehicles were transported by ambulance to UW Hospital with significant injuries. 
 
The Dane County Crash Reconstruction team continues to investigate the accident. Excessive speed is believed to be a factor in the crash. Portage Rd. was closed and traffic was diverted for several hours to facilitate emergency care and the crash investigation. 
 
The victim’s identity will be released by the Dane County Medical Examiner’s Office following the notification of her family.
